1.title: Too Easy
1.description:
The Abyssal Guardian falls with little effort. In the settling dust, something glints—a small charm with your initials carved into it. You don't remember making it. When did you have time? You only entered the tower this morning.

You pocket the charm and move forward, but the unease lingers.

2.title: Muscle Memory
2.description:
As the Vile Serpent collapses, its dying words echo in your mind: 'Third time... you've used that exact combo... muscle memory...'

What does that mean? You've never been here before. Have you?

3.title: The Whispers
3.description:
Warlord Grakthar's body dissolves, but the whispers remain. Hundreds of voices bouncing off the chamber walls, all pleading, all desperate. And they all sound like you.

'How many times?'
'I can't remember their faces anymore.'
'Please, someone remember me.'

You press your hands to your ears, but the voices come from inside your head.

4.title: Cycle 7
4.description:
Necromancer Voss crumbles to ash. Behind where he stood, you find a leather-bound journal. The cover is worn, the pages yellowed. You open it.

The handwriting is yours.

'Cycle 7: I'm starting to remember. The tower doesn't kill us—it recycles us. Every time we reach the top, we're sent back down with our memories erased. But fragments remain. I need to leave myself clues.'

Your hands shake. Cycle 7? What cycle are you on now? When did you write this? You search the rest of the journal, but every other page has been torn out.

5.title: Forty-Seven Cycles
5.description:
The Blackblade Marauder falls, and with his last breath: 'I was a hero once... just like you... forty-seven cycles ago...'

You search his lair and find something that makes your blood run cold—a wanted poster. Your face. Your name. Dated five years ago. But you only entered the tower yesterday. Didn't you?

6.title: The Vision
6.description:
The Arachnok Queen's body dissolves into mist. Her web remains, shimmering with an otherworldly light. Against your better judgment, you touch it.

The vision hits you like a physical blow. You see yourself at the summit of the tower, victorious. Your god descends to congratulate you. You reach out—

And then you're at the bottom again. Memories gone. Starting over.

The vision ends. You stumble backward, gasping. Your hands have scars you don't remember getting.

7.title: Cycle 44
7.description:
Lich Lord Moros fades into spectral mist, his final words haunting: 'You're on Cycle 44... there's a mark... behind your left ear...'

With trembling fingers, you reach behind your ear. You feel them immediately—small notches carved into your skin. You count them.

Forty-three.

You don't remember making them. Your hand moves on its own, pulling a small blade from your pack. You carve the forty-fourth notch, watching your own blood drip onto the stone floor.

Forty-four times. How long have you been trapped here?

8.title: They're Watching
8.description:
As the Frostfire Behemoth falls, divine light fills the chamber. Words appear in the air, written in fire and gold—a message from your god:

'You're doing wonderfully, my champion. Keep climbing. Glory awaits at the summit.'

The words should inspire you. They should fill you with purpose. Instead, they feel hollow. Empty. Like lines from a script you've heard too many times before.

9.title: Can't Die Here
9.description:
The Crystalwing Matriarch collapses, her wings shattered. As she fades, she shows you something—old fractures covering every bone. 'Some climbers try to escape... throw themselves off the tower... but you can't die here permanently... you just wake up at the bottom...'

You look over the edge of the tower. The ground is impossibly far below. For a moment, you consider it. But you know she's right. Death isn't an escape. It's just another reset.

10.title: All Your Deaths
10.description:
You shatter the mirror. The glass explodes into hundreds of fragments, each one showing a different version of you. Different ages. Different scars. Different expressions. But all of them have the same look in their eyes—desperation.

Among the shards, you find another journal entry in your handwriting:

'Cycle 29: I'm going to make it this time. I have to. I can't forget them again. I can't forget her name. Please, if I'm reading this—her name was—'

The rest is burned away. Who was 'her'? Why can't you remember?

11.title: Tally Marks
11.description:
The walls of the Voidforged Sanctum are covered in tally marks. Not hundreds. Not thousands. Millions. Carved into every surface, overlapping, endless.

You find a clear spot and add five marks—one for each finger.

How many of these are yours?

12.title: Livestock
12.description:
Shadowmancer Kael's final revelation echoes in your mind: 'You're not a champion. You're livestock.'

As he dissolves, a memory breaks through the fog—you've fought him before. You've had this exact conversation. Seventeen times, you realize. And each time, you were shocked. Each time, you couldn't believe it.

But now you do.

13.title: Loop Within a Loop
13.description:
You find another climber on this floor—not a boss, but a person like you. They're sitting against the wall, staring at nothing.

'Turn back,' they whisper. 'I'm stuck. I'm always on Floor 13. I beat it, and then I wake up here again. Over and over.'

You try to help them. You try to bring them with you. But when you ascend to the next floor and look back, they're gone. The floor resets. And somewhere below, they're waking up on Floor 13 again.

Some people don't just repeat the tower. They repeat a single floor. Forever.

14.title: Warning From a God

god_messages.elysia: I tried to warn your kind. This tower was supposed to be destroyed. But the others... they enjoyed the harvest too much.
god_messages.sepulchure: You want honesty? I don't care about you. None of us do. But I respect your tenacity. You've climbed 44 times. Most break by 20.
god_messages.drakath: The cycle must be broken. But I can't break it from outside. Someone inside needs to shatter it. Climb higher. You'll understand.

15.title: M & J
15.description:
You find a room filled with equipment. Swords you don't remember wielding. Armor you've never seen. Trinkets from people whose faces you can't recall.

There's a locket on a shelf. Inside is a photograph—you with two other people. A woman and a child. You're smiling. They're smiling. On the back, in faded ink: 'We'll wait for you. Love, M & J.'

Who are M and J? Were they real? Are they still waiting?

How long have they been waiting?

16.title: Maya
16.description:
The Shapeshifter takes the form of someone important. You know they are. You can feel it. But you can't remember who.

'You promised you'd come back,' the Shapeshifter says in her voice. 'That was 44 cycles ago. I waited. I grew old. I died. And you don't even remember my name.'

As the Shapeshifter dies, it whispers: 'Maya. My name was Maya. Please... remember me this time.'

You pull out a knife and carve the name into your forearm, deep enough to scar. You will not forget. Not this time.

17.title: Changing
17.description:
You catch your reflection in a pool of water. Your eyes look different—harder, colder, older than they should be. Your skin is covered in scars that weren't there before.

You're changing. Becoming like the permanent residents of the tower. How long before you forget why you're human?

18.title: Time-Rot
18.description:
Chromaggus sniffs the air as he dies. 'You smell like time-rot... how many centuries have you been climbing?'

Centuries? No. You've only been here... how long? You try to remember when you entered. Yesterday? Last week? Last year?

You don't know. You genuinely don't know anymore.

19.title: 847 Steps
19.description:
The architecture stops making sense. You walk upward but feel like you're falling. Time skips. You blink and you're somewhere else. You blink again and you're back where you started.

Panic sets in. You're trapped. This is the end—

Then you see it. Scratched into the floor in your own handwriting: 'FLOOR 19 IS A TRAP. DON'T TRUST YOUR PERCEPTION. COUNT YOUR STEPS. EXACTLY 847 STEPS FORWARD.'

You count. On step 847, the illusion shatters. How many cycles did it take past-you to figure that out? How many times did you die here?

20.title: The Vision of Maya
20.description:
Halfway there. The tower rewards you with a vision—your future victory at the summit.

But then the vision continues. You see the reset. The memory wipe. And then it shows you something new—alternate timelines. In one, you're not alone. There's a woman with you. Maya. She's smiling, laughing, fighting by your side.

Then Floor 27. She's hit. She's dying. You hold her as the light leaves her eyes. She says something, but you can't hear it.

Then the reset. You forget her. And in the next cycle, she's not there. You left her behind. Left her to die. And you didn't even remember her name.

The vision ends. You vomit.

21.title: For Me
21.description:
Your god sends another message. The pretense is gone now:

'I can feel your doubt, my champion. You're wondering if this is worth it. Let me assure you—it is. For me.'

They're not even trying to hide it anymore.

22.title: The First Key
22.description:
Banshee Queen Shriekara's form wavers as she dies. 'We all made deals with gods... they promised everything... gave us this prison...'

She presses something into your hand—a key made of bone, cold and ancient.

'Floor 30 has two doors. One leads to the reset. One leads out. This key opens the second door. But—'

She dissolves before she can finish. But you understand. There's a way out. You just have to reach it.

23.title: The Second Key
23.description:
Voidlord Malgros crumbles into shadow. As he fades, he drops something—another key.

'You think you're special? You're not the first to remember. You're not the first to reach this floor with clarity. You're just the first in this cycle.'

'There are three keys. Three doors. One for each god's ending. Choose wisely.'

Two keys now. One more to go.

24.title: The Tower's Heart
24.description:
You reach the tower's core. It's vast—a cathedral of twisted architecture and pulsing energy. Thousands of glowing threads hang from the ceiling, each one connected to a climber somewhere in the tower.

You find yours. It's old. Worn thin. Frayed at the edges. It's been stretched across 44 cycles.

Then the tower speaks. Not a boss. Not a god. The tower itself:

'You're breaking. I can feel it. Most break by now. But you're stubborn. That's why you're my favorite.'

The tower is alive. It's been the prison all along.

25.title: The Third Key
25.description:
The Pyroclasmic Overfiend dies, and with his final breath: 'The gods didn't build this tower. I did. They just... took advantage of my work.'

He drops the third key. 'If you use all three keys at once... I don't know what happens. No one's ever collected all three.'

You now hold all three keys. You can feel their power humming in your hands. Three gods. Three doors. One hidden exit.

The choice is coming.

26.title: You Were Kinder Then
26.description:
Sangromancer Malroth falls. His last words cut deep:

'I knew you in Cycle 12. We climbed together. We were friends. You don't remember, but I do. You were kinder then.'

What has this tower done to you? What have you become?

27.title: Maya's Letter
27.description:
You find her. Maya. Her body is here, preserved by the tower's magic, exactly where she fell. She's been here since Cycle 12—32 cycles ago.

There's a note clutched in her hand, written in shaking letters:

'If you're reading this, you've forgotten me again. I love you. I forgive you. Please break the cycle. Don't let anyone else end up like me. -M'

You sit beside her body and cry. You don't remember when you last cried. Maybe you never have. Not in this cycle.

You place her letter in your pack. You will not forget again.

28.title: Last Chance
28.description:
Abyssal Enderark's final warning: 'Last chance to turn back. Floor 30 changes everything. Every person who reaches the summit makes a choice. And every choice is wrong.'

You're not turning back. You've come too far. Lost too much. Forgotten too much.

Floor 30 is above. The gods are waiting.

29.title: They're Waiting
29.description:
Tidal Terror Abaddon dissolves into mist. 'The gods are waiting for you. All three of them. They're going to make you an offer. They've made it to everyone who reached the top. No one has ever refused.'

'Be the first.'

You can see Floor 30 above you. The summit glows with divine light. This is it. The end of the cycle. Or the beginning of something else.

You think of Maya. Of the 44 scars behind your ear. Of the stranger trapped on Floor 13. Of all the versions of yourself lost in the tower's memory.

You climb the final staircase.

30.title: The Choice
30.description:
The summit is not a battlefield. It's a throne room. Three gods stand before you: Elysia, radiant and cold. Sepulchure, dark and smiling. Drakath, shifting and chaotic.

Behind them, you see three doors. And then, in the corner of your vision, a fourth door. Hidden. Shimmering. Locked by three keyholes.

Elysia speaks: 'Impressive. You've maintained coherence through 44 cycles. Most shatter by 30.'

Sepulchure laughs: 'You have three keys. Smart. We were wondering if anyone would figure that out.'

Drakath grins: 'You have a choice to make, mortal. And this time, the choice actually matters.'

You grip the three keys in your hand. The weight of 44 cycles presses down on you. The memory of Maya burns in your mind.

The gods wait. The doors wait. Your decision will change everything.

**What will you choose?**

door_1_elysia.title: The New Administrator
door_1_elysia.description:
You step through Elysia's door. Light envelops you. She offers you freedom—if you become the tower's new administrator. You'll never have to climb again. You'll be free.

You accept.

The tower's power flows into you. You become its guardian, its keeper. And then you see him—a young man entering the tower, eyes bright with hope. He's you. A younger version, memory wiped, ready to start Cycle 45.

You try to warn him. The tower won't let you. Your voice comes out as: 'Welcome to the Tower of Ascension. Your god has sponsored your entry.'

The cycle continues. And now you're complicit.

**TO BE CONTINUED...**

door_2_sepulchure.title: Welcome, Brother
door_2_sepulchure.description:
You step through Sepulchure's door. Darkness enfolds you. He offers you godhood—if you can kill one of the other gods and take their place. True power. True freedom.

You accept.

Divine power floods your veins. Sepulchure throws you into battle with Elysia. You fight across dimensions, across time itself. Eons pass in seconds. You're winning. You're actually winning—

You deliver the killing blow.

Everything goes white.

You wake up on Floor 1.

You still have your divine power. You still remember everything. But you're in the tower. You try to leave. You can't. The walls won't let you pass.

Sepulchure's laughter echoes from everywhere: 'Did I forget to mention? Gods can't leave the tower either. Welcome to eternity, brother.'

**TO BE CONTINUED...**

door_3_drakath.title: Between All Things
door_3_drakath.description:
You step through Drakath's door. Reality fractures. He offers you true freedom—if you become something neither mortal nor divine. A paradox. A being that exists between cycles.

You accept.

Time shatters. You're on Floor 1 and Floor 30 simultaneously. You're in Cycle 1 and Cycle 44 at once. You see Maya alive. You see her dead. You see yourself winning and losing, living and dying, remembering and forgetting.

Every possibility. Every timeline. All at once.

Drakath's laughter echoes across infinite moments: 'Now you understand. This is freedom. Every possibility, every timeline, all at once. Most go mad instantly. But you? You might survive. Good luck.'

You're free from the linear cycle. But you're trapped in ALL cycles at once. Forever.

**TO BE CONTINUED...**

door_4_freedom.title: OUTSIDE
door_4_freedom.description:
You ignore the gods. You walk past them, the three keys burning in your hand. You approach the hidden fourth door.

All three gods shout at once:
'STOP. That door—'
'—was never meant to be opened—'
'—it leads Outside—'
'—and we can't follow you there.'

You insert all three keys. The door opens. Light spills out—real light, not divine light. Sunlight.

You step through.

---

You emerge into a plaza. The sky is wrong—too red, with three suns. Around you stretch thousands of towers, each identical to the one you just left. The God Farm.

Beings wander the plaza—humans, elves, demons, creatures you can't name. All scarred. All broken. All free.

An old woman approaches. She has 147 notches behind her ear.

'First time Outside?' she asks.

You nod, unable to speak.

'Welcome to the Harvest Plaza. There are ten thousand towers here. You escaped one.' She gestures to the vast cityscape. 'Where did you think divine power comes from?'

You look at your hands. 44 scars behind your ear. Maya's name carved into your arm. The three keys crumbling to dust.

'Most people go back in,' she says. 'Can't handle the truth. Some try other towers. It never helps.'

'What do you do?' you ask.

'Some of us fight. Try to shut down the towers. Free everyone. It's not going well. Gods are stronger than we thought. And there are so many of them.' She extends a hand. 'But we could use someone who collected all three keys. That takes someone special.'

You look back at your tower. New climbers enter, bright-eyed and naive. You think of Maya. Of all the versions of you still trapped inside.

'Tell me everything,' you say.

'It's going to be a long conversation. Come. We have a camp. Others like us. And a plan.'

She starts walking. You follow.

Behind you, the Battle Tower hums, pulling in fresh souls. The harvest continues.

But now you know the truth. And you're going to burn it all down.

**TO BE CONTINUED IN: THE GOD FARM**

prestige_changes.note: Dialogues and victory text should subtly change based on prestige count
prestige_changes.1-5: Normal run. No hints of the loop.
prestige_changes.6-10: Bosses start making odd comments. Déjà vu increases.
prestige_changes.11-20: NPCs recognize you. You find your own journals.
prestige_changes.21-30: The whispers get louder. Others beg for freedom.
prestige_changes.31-43: Gods speak directly. The fourth door becomes visible.
prestige_changes.44+: Full memory. The Old Woman appears before entry, offering escape.
